title: House select committee targets 134-year-old law in effort to prevent another January 6
description: Members of the January 6 committee are working on potential legislation to tighten the process of certifying a presidential election in an effort to eliminate contentious avenues that spurred the January 6 riot, sources tell CNN.

title: GameStop COO leaves after seven months on the job
description: GameStop chief operating officer Jenna Owens is leaving the company seven months after joining it, the company said in a regulatory filing.

title: Alec Baldwin speaks out about Halyna Hutchins and guns on sets
Super Mario Bros. 2 video game sells for $88,550
description: A sealed Super Mario Bros. 2 video game from 1988 found at the back of a walk-in closet in Indiana has sold for more than $88,000, according to the auction house handling its sale.

title: Fox News is quietly trying to distance itself from Tucker Carlson's January 6 trutherism
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: Architect rips billionaire's college dorm project: 'Unsupportable ... as an architect, a parent and a human being'
description: Billionaire Charlie Munger is bankrolling the design of a massive dormitory at the University of California, Santa Barbara. The $1.5 billion project comes with a major catch — 94% of the dorm's single occupancy rooms have no windows.

title: Massive crowds demonstrate against military takeover in Sudan
description: Hundreds of thousands of people are demonstrating across Sudan in protest of Monday's military's takeover, marking the largest protest against the coup yet.

title: Mexico recovers three ancient artifacts from Italy
description: Mexico on Friday recovered three ancient artifacts that were stolen and bound for auction in Italy as the Latin American country holds a global campaign to recover its art and relics.

title: Hebrew speakers mock Facebook's new name
The National Archives outlined how the former President tried to hide his White House's support for overturning the 2020 election
description:
• Fox News is quietly trying to distance itself from Tucker Carlson's January 6 trutherism
•'Completely damning' video of Trump ally emerges

title: Mummies found buried in boats in a China desert have unexpected origins
description: Commercial genetic tests can unveil surprising details about your roots. My Chinese mother-in-law, born in Hong Kong, found out she was a quarter Irish. The test results even pinpointed the county from where her previously unknown Irish grandfather originated.

title: What we learned this week in the trial of Elizabeth Holmes
description: This week in the criminal trial of Elizabeth Holmes, jurors heard how the billionaire family of former Education Secretary Betsy DeVos eagerly poured nearly $100 million into failed blood-testing startup Theranos after a visit to its Palo Alto headquarters.

title: Disappointed Emma Raducanu still adjusting to life on tour
description: US Open champion Emma Raducanu said she was still coming to terms with the fast pace of life on tour but vowed to brush aside her disappointing loss in the Transylvania Open on Friday and come back stronger.

title: Gunshots rang out as St. Louis mayor was discussing gun violence prevention. She didn't flinch
description: Gunshots rang out Friday as St. Louis Mayor Tishaura Jones was discussing gun violence prevention during a news conference -- and she did not flinch.

title: Trump lawyer said 'courage and the spine' would help Pence send election to the House
description: John Eastman, a conservative lawyer working with then-President Donald Trump's legal team, said in a radio interview in early January that then-Vice President Mike Pence had the power to throw the 2020 presidential election to the House of Representatives, saying it depended on whether Pence had "courage and the spine." Those comments are more direct than how Eastman has recently described his conversation with Pence, when he has said he told the vice president it was an "open question" whether he could throw out seven states' Electoral College votes and that it'd be a "foolish" option to pursue.

title: Nets owner Joseph Tsai unsure when unvaccinated Kyrie Irving will play again
description: Brooklyn Nets owner Joseph Tsai said he is not sure when Kyrie Irving will play for them again, with the guard unable to join the team having chosen not to get vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: The horror movie genre started with this 1896 short film
description: From a silent film in 1896 to Jordan Peele's "Get Out," horror movies have evolved to capitalize on what we fear most. Watch this week's "Pop Off" and subscribe to Lisa's "Pop Life Chronicles" newsletter here.

title: The city that fears there'll be 'nothing left' after oil
These travel destinations are reopening soon
description: There are only two months left in 2021 and as we enter November, countries around the world are relaxing their Covid-19 restrictions. Here are 10 destinations that have made headlines in pandemic travel news this week.

title: A Mormon church, its bishop and a contractor ordered to pay nearly $1 million for making children work without pay for years
description: A federal judge in Utah ordered the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints (FLDS) and two of its affiliates to pay nearly $1 million for allegedly violating child labor laws when they employed minors on a ranch without paying them for years.

title: Why Friday is the scariest day for those who stand up to Vladimir Putin
description: Friday is the cruelest day for Russia's opposition. In small, overheated flats, coffee houses and newsrooms, journalists hover over their screens waiting to see if the Motherland has painted them with a stigma close to "traitor."

title: UFC 267: How to watch two blockbuster titles fights
description: UFC 267 is looking to be must-see viewing for fight fans.

title: Everything you never knew about swimming
description: Few things can match going for a swim in the ocean or a lake for its sense of freedom and belonging to something greater.

title: The city that fears there'll be 'nothing left' after oil
description: The people who made their fortunes in the oil capital of Europe need a new plan.

title: Biden's credibility is on the line this weekend
DHS releases rules for opening land borders to foreign nationals next month
description: The Department of Homeland Security on Friday issued new rules for reopening the nation's land borders on November 8.

title: Zayn Malik pleaded no contest to harassment charges in alleged dispute with Gigi and Yolanda Hadid
description: Pop star Zayn Malik pleaded no contest to charges of harassment earlier this month following an alleged dispute with Yolanda Hadid, the mother of his supermodel partner Gigi Hadid, court documents reveal.

title: Apple sounds a $6 billion holiday season warning
description: What will dominate this holiday shopping season: Huge demand, as shoppers use pent-up savings to splurge, or supply chain problems leading to empty shelves and presents on back order?

title: Britney Spears' wedding dress designer looks back on 25 years of celebrity gowns
description: Filipina American fashion designer Monique Lhuillier wants to realize your dreams. She wants you to imagine yourself dressed in cream silks, lace and verdant florals, racing through Lake Como gardens and towards the love of your life -- a scene captured in one of her brand's recent campaigns.

title: Government watchdog blasts State and Defense departments for withholding key information about Afghanistan
description: The US government's Afghanistan watchdog blasted the State and Defense departments for withholding critical information about their work in Afghanistan that "almost certainly would have benefited Congress and the public in assessing whether progress was being made."

title: The problem with Ted Cruz's defense of a Nazi salute
description: You have to hand it to Sen. Ted Cruz; his timing was impeccable. On the anniversary of the deadliest attack on Jews in US history, Cruz raised his voice in the Senate to defend an American's right to brandish the Nazi salute.

title: LA home of 'Real Housewives of Beverly Hills' star was robbed
description: The home of "The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" star Dorit Kemsley was robbed Wednesday night.

title: Wife had to choose between her marriage and the vaccine
description: Covid-19 vaccine conspiracy theories spreading on social media have been tearing families apart. CNN Business's Donie O'Sullivan spoke to one woman whose oncologist recommended she get the vaccine. Her anti-vaxx husband gave her an ultimatum.

title: Prince Andrew's attorneys ask to dismiss US sex assault lawsuit saying it violates the terms of a settlement agreement
description: Attorneys for Prince Andrew are asking for a lawsuit filed against him by Virginia Roberts Giuffre to be dismissed, saying it violates the terms of a settlement agreement with sex offender and disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, where she agreed to a "general release" of claims against the two men and others.

title: Xi's pledge to redistribute wealth brings back bad memories for luxury brands in China
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping's national campaign for "common prosperity" has cast a shadow over an industry that counts the country as one of its biggest markets: luxury goods.
